intro: Dendranthema foliaceum, commonly known as the yarrow plant, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its feathery, aromatic leaves and flat-topped clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Yarrow is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its medicinal properties. It is often used in herbal remedies for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
